name: impermanency
content:

the state of not lasting forever, or not lasting for a long time: One can become convinced of the impermanency of all such phenomena. Refugee status indicates a degree of impermanency.
More examplesFewer examplesShe learned a lesson from the impermanency of the Ballet, which had no home theatre, and was always touring.We aim to promote the adoption of children into stable families, rather than allowing children to remain in the impermanency of foster care.
